body_html: @apaszke Having a predictable/consistent style removes unnecessary cognitive overhead (at least for me it does), regardless of the style that is used. I would like to stick to it for c10d, yes. We can formalize this later though, right now only @teng-li and myself are checking in code.

body: @apaszke Having a predictable/consistent style removes unnecessary cognitive overhead (at least for me it does), regardless of the style that is used. I would like to stick to it for c10d, yes. We can formalize this later though, right now only @teng-li and myself are checking in code.
